0: WASHINGTON (AP) â€” The U.S. unemployment rate plunged in April to its lowest level since September 2008 as employers added 288,000 jobs, the most in two years. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The figures are a clear sign that the economy is picking up after a brutal winter slowed growth. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Labor Department says the unemployment rate fell to 6.3 percent from 6.7 percent in March. But the drop occurred because the number of people working or seeking work fell sharply. People not seeking work aren't counted as unemployed.
